Reviews.Title: “a visit”
Reviews.Author: Viktoria O
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a very central location. the breakfast is very rich. the staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central, modern and cosy”
Reviews.Author: NickLefkosia
Reviews.Content: Warm welcoming, assisting me in every aspect. Clean rooms, changing of linen every other day and reach breakfast. They even serve you cava - sparkling wine - at the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiotis
Reviews.Content: A very nice, very clean hotel within walking distance of most attractions and the center. We stayed in a room with a balcony, which had beautiful views over the city roofs and was very clean indeed. Large bathroom, good size room. Breakfast was plenty and fresh. The reception staff was very helpful and gave us very good reccomendations for restaurants and anticipated things for us we would not have thought of. All very nice and a big thank you to all and especially to Marco (I think the name was) who really went out of his way to helps us in numerous things. We will definitely stay again in this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mcveanj1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 4th April to the 6th April 2012. The Hotel is in a great location. Just 10 minutes walk las Ramblas and easy to get to all of the big tourist attractions. The hotel is very clean, with lovely rooms and the breakfast is outstanding. We would definatly recommend this hotel as it was the icing on the cake for a fantastic trip to Barcelona, We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, petit hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbcollege
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. It is perfectly located in the centre of Barcelona. Walking distance nearly to everywhere. check in and check out was great, the female staff at reception was great, helpful and professional. However I did not get welcome drink as indicated in my booking. Everything is so modern in this little hotel. My room was definitely up to date particular the bath room. Room is tiny at least my room is. Tiny little desk, double bed and very small bathroom. It reminds me of HK or Japan. Breakfast starts 7 am, very nice breakfast and very quiet in early morning. Staff are usually friendly and helpful, except the male afternoon staff at reception. He seems always in a hurry. I don't understand why a 4 star hotel need to charge 2 Euro extra for using safe box. surely the hotel could include in the price of the room. There is no tea or coffee facilities in the room. I walked everywhere from the hotel. Another annoying thing is you can clearly hear your neighbour coughing, and people walk in and out of their rooms. There is a supermarket around the corner, if you need anything just out of hotel turn left, first street turn right. The supermarket on your left hand side. It was very pleasant stay and I will definitely come back to the hotel again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTA2207
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 2 weeks and was pleased to find this hotel absolutely charming. We were a bigger group and everybody was very impressed with this hotel. Very nice and helpful personnel, rooms were not very big, but very well equipped, extremely comfortable bed, and i liked the fact that the cleaning ladies left the heating and the curtains exactly as i left them in the morning. i appreciated this. normally, at all the others hotels that i stayed in, especially in Barcelona, in the evening when i returned to my room, everything was turned off, but not here. breakfast was very good, they had a small terrace outside in a back yard, very cute. the swimming pool was more like a bigger bath tub, and it was surrounded by blocks of flats, not that nice. but the location was excellent, 10 min walk from Rambla, very close to the metro- Urquinaona stop. i was in town for Alimentaria exhibition, and by metro, it took me about 25 min to get to the Fira Barcelona- Gran Via- great! the cost of the seif was not included, and for that you had to pay extra- 2euro/day, but the internet was free. the parking was 25 euro/day. but overall, i would recommend this hotel, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visit the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Cristian C
Reviews.Content: Nice position, 25-30 min by car from the airport, 5-10 min. to walk to the Plaza Catalunya where you can take the touristic bus. Rooms are modern but small (even the superior rooms are a little bit small - but in exchange you have a terrace). If you want to use the safe deposit in your room you will be charged 2 euros/day extra. Breakfast is OK, good ideea with the variety of choices and Cava but, of course, there are things to improved for a 4 stars hotel (cheese is cut very, very small and some tuna or "boquerones en vinagre" will be appreciate as well as olives... because we are in Spain, don't we?). Helpful front-desk, good housekeeping service, garage facilities but small and expensive - 27 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Ruth11111111
Reviews.Content: Hotel: in my opinion,it'S A 4 STAR. At arriving, it isn't atractive from the outside, it seems you are entering an office building if you compare it to the beautiful historical buildings around. The lobby is quite simple, with no ostentation. However, the rooms are very nice, a bit small, and the bathroom is excellent. My room had a street view, and I had breakfast included in the rate. Breakfast is excellent and complete, with eggs,pastry, fruits, cheeses and cold meats, including famous spanish ham, and cava, an spanish white wine. Very friendly and helpful staff. Location: The hotel is 10 minutes walk to Plaza Catalunya, 3 blocks away from Passei de Gracia. in my opinion, perfect. Some Tips: Places to eat:La Rita, Ca La Nuri for typical spanish seafood, Cerveceria Catalana and Ciudad Condal for tapas, last 2 places be patient, at least 30 minutes wait in central hours, unless you show up too late or too early. Another good thing is to take the touristic bus, hop on hop off bus, it's en excellent way to get to know the city, which is really beautiful. Don't miss Park Guell, las Ramblas, Monumento a Colon, La Barceloneta; Paseo de Gracia with historical Gaudi buildings Casa Batllo and La Pedrera, the beautiful Barrio Gotico, Sagrada Familia Church, and the colorful Mercado de la Boqueria.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the city center”
Reviews.Author: manouschka
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel with nice rooms equipped with a large bathroom(bath+showerlots of mirrors, hairdryer), flat screen TV and safe . The window of the room opens (room 612). Small minibar with space to put your own stuff. Free wifi in the room and 2 pc's to use in the lobby. There's also an outdoor pool. Continental breakfast is very good. Staff is multilingual, friendly and helpfull. No problems for late check in or keeping the luggage when checking out. One of the best hotels i stayed at in Barcelona. Only one negative remark: we had roomservice. They we're in such a hurry that the meat wasn't baked enough, the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for privat and business stay”
Reviews.Author: Eseter
Reviews.Content: We have had a sale conference for 3 days, 30 people at the hotel. Meeting rooms and possibility to use the nice back yard and pool area for recreation during the breaks were great. Breakfast and lunch very delicate and highly appreciated by all. Location great for shopping and walks in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all around”
Reviews.Author: UptonTravelers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a key location to see all the sights

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mosiniak
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't directly on a metro stop, but it is only a few blocks away. A very short 2-3 minute walk and you are on Line 1 or Line 3 which will take you virtually anywhere in Barcelona via their great metro service. Our room had a walk out deck that connect you to the pool. It was great to have this little space to relax outside, yet so near your room. The room was tight, but comfortable and clean. The shower was probably the big "Problem" I would complain about. The shower drains VERY, VERY slow. Do NOT put the water on full blast or you will swamp the bathroom floor in a matter of a few minutes. We talked to other guests of the hotel and they had the same problem. The other thing they should work on are the THIN walls. you could hear every footstep, metro, elevator and people talking between floors and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: mipu69
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely situated within walking distance from subway and attractions. Staff is friendly and the hotel is clean, breakfast has good variaty and it was fresh. What we did not like, was the thin walls. You could hear almost everything from next door and from the corridor. You could hear and feel the subway going, which was not very nice. We would not stay in this hotel again, due to very little sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent one-night stopover”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to a NCL Jade 9 night cruise and found the hotel perfect. We were greeted on arrival with a complentary glass of "fizzy" and shown to our room that was typically business class, eficient with all modern ameneties. The hotel was within easy walk to Metro or 20 mins walk to the top of Las ramblas. We ate in the hotel which was sufficient as we did not want anything over the top prior to a reasonably lenghty cruise. The service was a little slow but adequate. All in all a good place to stay with excellent, friendly and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever stay in 1st floor”
Reviews.Author: Eren78
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel since 2009 and this time I made a mistake of accepting a room from the 1st floor. It was horrible, every time the train comes to the metro station you wake up with the vibration and noise. I would never stay in floor 1 again neither you should. Other than that, it is a very nice hotel with good location and nice breakfast. I totally recommend the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “City Break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Terry1961
Reviews.Content: Very good , clean, modern hotel. Staff are fantastic and most speak very good English. From the welcoming glass of Cava, complimentary as we checked in, to final check out everyone was very curtious and helpful. Marcos on reception even arranged tickets for us to watch Barcalona at Nou Camp. Breakfast was a good selection of hot & cold buffett, with pastries in abundance. Location is ideal with Sagrada Familia, La Rambla and many other attractions all within a twenty minute walk. Definately going back later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Winter break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PaphosPhilH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here in January 2012 and were impressed straight away when offered a complimentary glass of cava as we checked in. It is a modern hotel close to the old city and within walking distance of the waterfront area. There is a handy Metro station about 200 metres away for more distant connections. The staff were very friendly and helpful with tourist enquiries. Breakfasts are served in a smart dining area with a very wide choice of dishes to suit most palates The staff are very attentive.They had noted that it was my birthday during our stay and brought a couple of cup-cakes with lighted candles to our breakfast table. Nice touch. We didn't use the restaurant facilities for any other meals. Rooms are of a reasonable size with all the expected amenities including mini-bar, hairdrier and satellite TV with programs from a range European countries. Free wi-fi is available through-out the hotel. The bathroom was a decent size and everything was spotlessly clean. Our room faced an inner courtyard and was very quiet. The hotel is situated on the busy Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes and is a very convenient centre from which to explore this beautiful city. I would definitely consider using this hotel again and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: VincenzoFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Our cruise travel agent, booked us into this hotel, for one night,at the end of our Canary Island cruise. We were told that it was convenient, for Placa Catalunya, and the Rambla. Before we left the UK, I e-mailed the hotel, requesting an early check-in, as having cruised before, at the end of the cruise, you are almost ' persona non grata ', i.e., they want you off the ship, asap. This being the case, I knew that we would arrive earlier than the normal check-in time. The reply, explained, that they would try to accommodate our request, but could not promise. On arrival at the hotel, at about 0945hrs, we were offered a room immediately, but as we had requested a room on a higher floor, we had the choice of waiting for this, or accepting a lower option. We decided to wait, and take the higher floor. We took one of the city tours, and returned at about 1300hrs, to find our room was ready. Our opinion was, that it was a very good city hotel bedroom. Very modern,clean and bright. The reception staff ( Jose ) was very helpful, ( although I think he forgot to offer us the complementary cava on arrival! ) . The breakfasts were very good, and again the staff were excellent, friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel, is very good. A short walk to the Placa Catalunya, where the city tours commence, but also where the airport bus terminates. As the Rambla, emanates from this Placa, this too was convenient. Regarding the value/cost, I cannot honestly rate, as it was part of our cruise holiday, and was not an addition, so do not know the price paid. However, I can without doubt recommend this hotel, for the staff, cleanliness and location. The hotel also has free computer/internet access. There is also an outdoor pool, but in December, we did not partake of the opportunity! Should we return to Barcelona, it would be the first hotel my wife and I would consider.

Reviews.Title: “A no brainer!”
Reviews.Author: Judi K
Reviews.Content: Did my homework and it really paid off. Great hotel in very central location. Modern interior, spacious room, great bathroom with deep tub made for a six footer! Beds are very comfortable and housekeeping does a fine job. Everything a hotel should be including a tasty breakfast buffet. Flat acreen tv, phone in bathroom, fridge and safe (extra charge) in room.Very attentive staff who obviously care about making your stay perfect and ensuring a return stay here at this property.. I can unequivocably recommend this spot.

Reviews.Title: “very clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7august
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November for 2 nights it is a very friendly hotel and all staff are very helpful. We paid for a superior room but were upgraded to a room with terrace and coffee machine on arrival and a bottle of cava left in room that evening which was a nice touch. Couldn't make much use of terrace due to bad weather when we were there. Room was very spacious and immaculate and plenty of tea and coffee facilities. Room cleaned every day and towels changed if required. About 20 min walk to Placa Catalunya where you got city bus tour. I recommend you take the Bus Turisted tour which cost 30 euros for 2 days which is well worth it to see the city sights. Barcelona is such a big city with loads to see! Make sure you got to Park Guell to see the architecture. Breakfast at the hotel was good with a large choice of hot or cold food to choose from. There cocktails were very reasonable and a nice to way to end your evening. We eat in Via70 restaurant on Las Ramblas which was good value for money and very nice. Also Lactuca pizza pasta eat as much as you like for 11.95 was good and is next to metro station Urquinaona. Also Ski Bar was very good value and friendly service positioned on V.Laietana definitelt worth a visit wine was 2 euros a glass!! Also Patagonia on Las Ramblas was nice. You can get the A1 or A2 bus to Placa Catalunya and then walk to hotel. Walk up Passeig de Gracia keep going and you will come to Gran via and you go right. You have to pay for the safe in room. You can leave luggage at reception on day of departure. Bathroom had a glass door but didn't overlook the bedroom shower very powerfull and plenry of toiletries left in room.

Reviews.Title: “City break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pgmcornish
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our friends for two nights as an extension to a Mediterranean cruise, having chosen it for its convenience to the centre of Barcelona, La Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. It proved to be a very good choice as it is a very modern hotel (18 months old) with nice modern decor but very comfortable. All the staff from the receptionists to the room service and restaurant staff were very pleasant and could not have done more for us. The receptionists suggested places to eat and tours to take so that we maximised our time in the city. The rooms were first class, very clean with all the modern amenities expected including His/Hers bathrobes and slippers, Wi-Fi and a state of the art Krups capsule coffee maker in each room. We asked for extra coffee pods and these were produced .immediately. The "Continental" breakfast also proved a surprise as it consisted of various cereals, fruit, yoghurts, cold meats, cheeses, cooked eggs with bacon, sausage mushrooms and tomatoes -what you get for a "Full English" and more in London. I cannot recommend this hotel too highly, and this review is NOT written by someone from the hotel group, but by a genuine traveller who has been delighted with the Gran Via 678, but do not confuse it with the Gran Via hotel which is two blocks away (which may also be very good but is not the hotel reviewed here).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCarroll
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband recently stayed in this hotel for 2 nights before going on a cruise. We were welcomes with a glass of cava, and then shown to our room. Room was lovely and clean, bright and well air conditioned. The glass wall separating the bedroom from the bathroom didnt bother us as its well frosted but i can see how it would put some people off if they were staying with friends etc. Location is about 10 mins walk to the main Plaza Catalunya so while you are away from the main hussle and bussle, you are still quite central. My only complaint was the price as we visited during a festival. Staff had very little information on what was going on regarding this festival and were not eager to look stuff up for us. However we were charged about double the normal price which i though was a bit cheeky! have info on festival if you are putting prices up for that reason!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: DizzyMiss69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend with friends. The rooms were excellent with very comfortable beds,super shower and a mini fridge (which was actually the mini bar but we could store our water and soft drinks). We were about a 25 minute walk from Las Ramblas. The pool was a little disappointing being on a kind of mezzanine roof and very small; the major drawback was that although we only wanted to use it on one day access wasn't allowed until 11am. As the sun disappeared from the area about 4pm we felt this was quite restrictive. Breakfast was 10 euros and there was a lot of choice including all the usual continental choices plus a few hot choices. There was a digital safe in the room for which the charge was 2 euros a day but worth it for peace of mind though this type of safe is normally free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “h and jn”
Reviews.Author: john n
Reviews.Content: Excellent located hotel with clean modern air conditioned rooms and relaxing pool and terrace area. Reception and bar/ dining area staff were all friendly,polite and helpful and cleaners were unseen but very efficient. Breakfast menu is very good with empty trays replenished frequently and without fuss. Evening menu although limited in choice was excellent and reasonably priced.All in all great place for central barcelona and would be happy to repeat stay on any future visit

Reviews.Title: “Just right for us”
Reviews.Author: joanp
Reviews.Content: Modern style, sleek, comfortable rooms, well air-conditioned. We enjoyed the terrace pool to cool off in the afternoons. Large breakfast buffet with many good options. Very nice and helpful staff, with good restaurant suggestions, which we used and appreciated. Location is really good, walking distance to everywhere we needed to go. Close to the Passeig de Gracia, the Rambla, two Metro stations (purple and green lines). One problem, however, was the room our boys stayed in had obvious water damage in the bathroom and an odd odor that was not fixed, although we asked. I guess it was something they couldn't do anything about and they probably didn't have another room to switch them to, but I wish they had been more up front about this issue. While we thought it was a problem, our teenagers were unaffected.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: nicky c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 night, lovley hotel, staff very helpful, very clean. Walking distance to centre of Barcelona and under ground points. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fab fab hotel, will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: amflanagan
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was really fansastic - location, staff, cleanliness, safety. They even noticed from my passport that it was my birthday and sent up a bottle of champagne. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. All in all it added to a truly wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern boutique hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: chrispgr
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the first time during December 2010 on a business trip to Barcelona, for 4 nights. I wanted a modern and quiet business hotel, but on the other hand centrally located. I was very pleased with my stay. I would not have minded it being 1-2 blocks closer to Plaza Catalunya, but still an easy walking distance...The rooms even though not huge, they are quite big for business hotel standards around the world. The rooms and public areas are very clean and neat. The breakfast is good and has quite a good variety and good coffee (self service), even though I would substitute 2 more hot items with 2 cakes. The reception staff is very friendly and always helpful. I would surely stay there again during my next trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and service”
Reviews.Author: JayJayPotter
Reviews.Content: I was in Spain for business and stayed a few days extra to take in the sights of Barcelona. I was a single female traveler and a little nervous about getting around by myself. However I felt completely at ease thanks to the hotel staff. I was greeted with free champagne when I got to my room! They spoke great English and knew the area very well. I went down to see them frequently and they gave me great tips on things to do and how to get around. The hotel is very well kept. The rooms are somewhat small (of course this is common for Europe) but they are clean and modern. My only cons is that there is really no where to set your suitcase other than the desk. However the bathroom is very big and the shower is awesome. You are very close to all the action of Barcelona. I walked pretty much everywhere and the train stop is very close. I will definitely stay here in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, average everything else”
Reviews.Author: spriggyb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite new by the looks of it, staff are very friendly & location is excellent been walking distance of 10 to 15 mins to center of the city & La Rambla. Rooms were small enough but in very good condition. Unfortunately I had three issues with the place in that the double bed was tiny, in all honesty it was a large single, second problem we had was the noise from one of the lifts was like the rumbling of thunder & could be heard randomly through the night if your room is anywhere attached to the lift in question. The last problem didn't really affect me as I wasn't bothered about going for a swim was the so called pool, one stroke & you're at the far side, like the bed its just a large bath. Now in fairness the issues are minor enough & we booked well in advance of our trip so all in all considering the cost from booking early we got great value & judging by other hotel reports in Barcelona I wouldn't rule out going back here, watch this space....

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Sjrabbit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 2 years old and has all the amenities of a boutique hotel...we stayed here twice, once before a cruise and then after; our room was clean, modern, and very comfortable; the bath was luxurious for European standards; breakfast buffet very adequate and tasty, and we were presented with a bottle of champagne the first evenings of our stay...location is right near the placa Cataluna on the gran via Cortalenes...would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing attitude from staff”
Reviews.Author: Shocko_11
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends stayed in this hotel last weekend. While the hotel is lovely and modern and very central, my main complaint is the way that we were dealt with by the staff. We checked in late on Friday evening and then headed out to meet friends. Upon returning to my room late Friday night/ early Satruday morning, I heard a kind of crackling noise, and when I switched on the bedside lamp, I discovered that my side of the room was completely covered with ants! I threw a towel down over them, and tried to convince myself it was fine, but then when I pulled the covers back I discovered that there were ants all over my bed! The room was perfectly clean, and there were no ants there when we checked in, and I'm still not sure where they came from but they were literally crawling all over the place. To be fair to the staff I dealt with that night, they were very polite, and sent a night porter up to assess the situation. He sprayed all the ants ( there were a lot!) with ant-killer, but the problem was that there were then dead ants all over the room, and in the bed, and also very strong fumes from the spray. The girl on reception told me that unfortunately the hotel was full up so they could not offer me another room, but they offered me a coffee instead and said that I could wait in reception until morning! At this stage it was very late/early, so my friend and I opted to stay in our friends adjoining room as we really needed to get some sleep and didn't fancy having to sit in reception for a few hours- we were only in Barcelona for 48 hours and wanted to get up and see the sights the next day. So, on our first night, in a 4 star hotel, we ended up sleeping 4 people to two single beds. I woke up having fallen through the crack in the middle the next morning,tired and uncomfortable. The problem arose when we went to check out. My friend had booked the hotel and the money had been deducted straight away from her card so we felt that she should speak to the guy on reception about it. We felt that we had paid for two twin rooms, but that seeing as one of these rooms was unsuitable for use on the Friday night, we should not have to pay full price for it. Furthermore, the four of us had a most uncomfortable night's sleep and no-one in the hotel ( apart from the girl I had initial dealings with) seemed to care less. There was no follow-up phone call or enquiry that everything was o.k, no note through the door, nothing. When we raised the issue with the guy on reception he was quite rude and irate and told us that on no account would we be getting a discount, that they had rang our friend's room at 7.30 a.m on the Saturday morning to tell me that my room was being cleaned and that we hadn't answered ( because we were asleep and didn't hear the phone), and also that because I had come in late on Friday night/ Saturday morning that I wouldn't have made full use of the room anyway. I argued that this was completely irrelevant- A-It was none of his business what time I came home at, B- We did not hear the phone in the room at 7.30 a.m the next morning as we were trying to sleep 4 to a bed and who wants to be woken up at that hour of the morning anyway when they are on their holidays. The bottom line was that the room was unsuitable for use, we paid for 4 star accomodation and we did not get it, and were treated appallingly when we tried to reasonably request a discount. While this hotel is modern, and very central, if this is the way that they deal with customer issues, I would be wary of staying here. Customer service and satisfaction does not seem to be a priority. I intend to pursue the matter further.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: platypus06
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel because of boosting a car park not far away from the main hub of town, ie Las Ramblas.,Our first acquaintance with this hotel was a very friendly reception offering us a glass of champagne upon arrival and a lovely room with a private balcony on the 7th floor. Soon the staff came with a bottle of champagne for a gift. The room was perfect, all very modern and great conveniences, good bed . One of the great unusual europeen asset is that we could make our own cup of cafe in the morning in the room. Breakfast downstairs was included in the price and when we checked out we found out that our car parking was also included. Not only it was the best deal we had in Spain, it was also a great hotel, quiet in middle of a busy city and a staff that was multilingual and extremely friendly .We would have no problem going back there on a next visit to Barcelona/

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: psylocke71
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cleaned every day and they make the bed with new bedsheets every day also. Breakfast was great, can´t say anything that I missed. The staff was exellent, very polite and helpfull in every way. I can really recommend this fantastic hotel in beautyfull Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETTABLE !!!”
Reviews.Author: amyluna75
Reviews.Content: I HAVE PAST 5 NIGHT IN JULY 2010 IN THIS HOTEL AND IT WAS AN UNFORGETTABLE MOMENT!!! Indeed, the hotel is wonderfully located just 5 minutes walk from Plaza Cataluña! The reception staff is incredibly friendly and helpful (they speak english and french too). We did not want to have breakfast at the hotel but finally, after seeing it, we stayed to enjoy it every morning on the rest terrace(breakfast buffet) where the restaurant staff is charming. The room seemed to be the same size as the photos, the bedding is of very good quality and the products (shampoo, conditionner ...) were changed every day. The rooms are very clean! Only drawback, the pool is a bit small and not always sunny and there are few seats but it was an incredible moment of staying in this hotel! It is definitely my first choice for a future trip! so last advice : book and ENJOYED !

Reviews.Title: “Glass Door!”
Reviews.Author: Peartree29
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff on reception and throughout the hotel. We did see people given a drink on arrival but we were not offered one? Breakfast was delicious with a good assortment of choices. the prices at the bar were very reasonable compared to that on the square. The hotel is about 15 mins from the square and the airport buses. Brilliant location! The room was no bigger than a postage stamp with very little space around the bed. The small windows looked into the rooms opposite so we kept the curtains closed. We were not able to tell what sort of day it was until we got out of the room as you couldn't see the sky due to the closeness of the opposite rooms. Not really what you want when in Spain. The bed was positioned within a foot of the bathroom door which had a semi frosted sliding door. The toilet was to the right as you went in, right up against the door meaning you could be seen clearly sat on the loo. Not a good look when your partner is lying in bed. Lovely bathroom furniture but the window was in the shower and couldn't be opened properly because of the shower head. Very badly designed. The room was modern but very basic with no mirror or drawers to put anything and a very small wardrobe. The hotel was very clean and so were the rooms We had a good few days but spent very little time in the hotel as it wasn't somewhere we wanted to be lacking comfort, natural light and the glass door was definitely a no no. My son and partner stayed at the same hotel in December and had a lovely big room but still with the glass bathroom door (however they neglected to tell us that bit lol) Obviously not all the rooms are of the same size and quality. I wouldn't stay there again even though it is a very nice hotel. the room really let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: peter_thompson999
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona in April 2011 having surprised my girlfriend for her birthday. I booked the hotel as part of a package with Cresta Holidays (part of the Thomas Cook group). The hotel was fantastic. We arrived early at around 11am. Not surprising that our room wasnt ready, however the reception staff offered to keep our luggage and provided facilities to freshen up and get changed. They told us the room would be ready at 2pm. We then made the most of getting our bearings in Barcelona itself. The staff gave us maps and directed us to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas which is only a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel. We arrived back at 2pm and as promised the room was ready. As well as this, a glass of Champagne was given to us both which was a nice touch. The room we stayed in was 203 on the second floor. This overlooked Gran Via. The room was amazing. Very modern. The glassed bathroom was unique and something I have never experienced before. There were speakers in the bathroom and the best shower we have experienced in any city hotel. The bed was also extremely comfortable. Breakfast the following morning was equally as impressive with a vast selection of continental and cooked options. Plenty of tea and coffee on request. The lunch menu was also very good with large portions and reasonably priced. We had cocktails on our last evening in the bar. The waitress offered to do us surprise cocktails which were not on the menu - they were both lovely and a really nice touch. The staff could not do any more for you. They were very chatty and made our stay extra special. The hotel has a lovely terrace and a small swimming pool on the roof with very comfortable sun loungers. If I had to make one suggestion would be for a soap dish or holder to be added to the shower room - however this is nit picking because I do not have anything negative to say. I would, without hesitation suggest that if visiting Barcelona you stay in this hotel. It is a short distance from Las Ramblas and in a beautiful area. The rooms are luxurious and the whole hotel is spotlessly clean. You will not be disappointed. When we return to Barcelona we will definitely be coming back to the Grupotel Gran Via. The hotel was simply perfect in everyway. See pictures attached.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Regina_Valsani
Reviews.Content: Great attendance, cordial crew, confortable room and a great breakfast, for a fair price. Besides that, very well located, near of everything in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms not very comfy”
Reviews.Author: Dora_and_Map
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location at a good price - right in between the old city and the Eixample area and within walking distance of most sights. The rooms are a bit snug and there is just a thin plastic translucent partition separating the bathroom which makes it awkward even if you are sharing with your intimate partner. The free wi-fi did not work on our phone and the hotel just shrugged and said 'it works for everybody else' which was not very helpful. the breakfast buffet is very sumptuous and the staff there are very cheerful and flexible - they let us have breakfast even though we got there after the closing time.

Reviews.Title: “Kept awake all night with traffic”
Reviews.Author: craicagusceoil
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly especially one of the girls at breakfast. She was fantastic. She went out of her way to give us all the information we needed to have a full and exciting break away. The noise from the road was very bad and no chance of having a sleep. We never complained because we were delighted to get away and make the most of it. Dont be fooled by the picture showing the bar. They got a good photographer to fool people. It is a tiny area showing the table and chairs and they are actually outside. Very disappointing. Dont fall into the same trap as us. Expensive hotel for what your getting. I expected a nice bar with light entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, nice enough, good loc, too many faults for a better rating”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichNick
Reviews.Content: Good things: This is a modern hotel (only recently opened, I think), in a good location. It's a few minutes walk from several metro stations, and all the routes are safe and well lit. Great bathroom (apart from the window/door combination - see below) Free WiFi that worked well. Polite, helpful staff. Less good things: I didn't like being asked to pay in advance when I checked in. My room was way too narrow - it was difficult to get past the bed to get from desk to door. The combination of window in the bathroom and glass door from bedroom to bathroom means too much light at night. I had to wedge a blanket into window to be able to sleep. Room service menu very limited. Far too little shelf space, even for my limited clothes for a 4-day business trip. At first I thought the room safe was broken. On my last night I found a slip of paper in it explaining that I had pay to get a key to use it. Either way, I was unimpressed. Too much noise from the lifts in my room, which wasn't THAT close to them. Far too many cushions and pillows on the bed, which meant I need to find somewhere in the meagre storage space to put the excess.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: cityhotel71
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!!!! We stayed here for 2 nights and we had a great time. Rooms are small but very clean and the location is great. We paid only 135 Euros per night with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and nice!”
Reviews.Author: MissWorldExplorer
Reviews.Content: Our stay was exceptionally pleasant. The staff is extremely helpful and very nice. The food was great. The rooms were clean and extremely trendy. The only thing that bothered us was the air-conditioning in the room. They turned it off during the day and therefore the room would get a little muggy and humid. Also, the cleaning staff is nice but extremely loud in the morning. We got woken up by banging, pushing, vacuuming sounds from the nearby rooms. One morning it was so bad that I had to call the customer service desk and complain. I felt bad about it but it was something that needed to be addressed. Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish accommodation”
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 4 nights at hotel Grupotel Gran Via 678. First impression of the hotel was very nice, hotel looked modern and staff was very nice and helpful. Also when booking in, hotel served free champagne which was a very nice gesture. So beginning was very promising. We got our room from 2nd floor. Rooms were clean, spacy, modern and stylish. Beds were very comfortable and especially the bathroom was very nice. Rooms were quiet as well. Hotel's location is splendid, it is located just outside the most hectic La Rambla area. Neighbourhood is nice and safe, so there is no any problems travelling around the city by feet. Hotel is easily within a walking distance to La Rambla and for example to shore, but if you'd prefer public transportation it is easy as well. From the hotel there is good connections everywhere around the city, there is several Metrostations within a few blocks' walk, as well as bus stops. Also Plaça Catalunya is within 10 minutes walk, where from there is nice connections to airport etc (it is aerobuses destination). We didn't have breakfast (or dine) at hotel but there was a few nice pastelerias within a block. Restarant/dining area however seemed quite nice at the hotel too. Hotel has also a minor pool as well as free wifi. So, Plus for style and location, minus for...I don't seem to find any.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel, polite staff. Would use again.”
Reviews.Author: JB_Reggie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break in Barcelona and wanted to review this hotel. First impressions upon arrival were clean and modern with polite reception staff greeting us, and offering a glass of champagne. We were very pleased with the room, clean, modern, bright and high enough up not to be troubled by the underground at night. If possible get a room at the back overlooking the pool to enjoy a quieter night sleep. Bathroom was nice with a large shower and the glass wall to the bedroom didn't cause any problems. However no double bed only twin. Air con, english tv channels. We booked room only but were offered a discount on breakfast upon arrival. However this was still 10 euros each - good food but preferred a cheap cafe down the road where you could get coffee and croissant for 2 euros. Although the pool was very small it was a nice for a dip and to have outside space. Hotel also had WIFI and 2 computers in the bar with free internet. As for location, it depends what you want out of your stay. If you want hustle and bustle and to be in the thick of it, then this is probably a bit far out. However it was 10 min walk to start of Placa Catalunya which is then near the top of Las Ramblas. A walk down to the port would take about 40 mins. We found taxis quite expensive so preferred to walk however our feet were hurting lots by the end of the week. We had a great time in Barcelona, lots to see and do (however very expensive), a cafe every other shop, loads of great streets to get lost down and architecture to see, and always felt safe. We would definitely recommend this hotel if just a little far out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely style”
Reviews.Author: dominique_lea
Reviews.Content: Great located hotel, in very modern style. Nice staff, they cancelled our mini bar bill when we pointed that we didnt have an internet (we were one of the first guests so I suppose not everything was working properly). For me personally (which is not a fault of the hotel) very annoying thing was the underground that I heard and couldnt sleep because of it even if we stayed on the second floor but thats the 'beauty' of all cities I suppose. Apart from that nothing really to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: nuzzonick
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a great stay at the Gran Via 678. We arrived and were offered a drink whilst we waited approx 15 mins for the room to be ready (we were a bit early), there was free internet access and two free pc's with which to surf and pass the time. The room was exactly like the pictures as was the rest of the hotel - completely spotless and the staff were really friendly without being intrusive. We chose not to have breakfast in the hotel and that was fine we never felt pressured to change our plans. The biggest surprise was on Sunday (my partner's birthday) when we returned to our room after a day out sightseeing to find cake, candles and a bottle of cava with which to celebrate!! He had left a couple of cards on the side by the bed but we hadn't requested anything and it was a total surprise to receive such a lovely FREE gift!! I cannot recommend this hotel enough! the pool was very welcome of an evening too - if only to soak tired limbs! And the room had a lovely rain shower. All in all a fantastic experience - a great city made greater by the Gran Via 678!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Libianne
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located just 10 minutes from Placa Catalunya. Features all 19th century furniture. Breakfast under chandeliers with classical music playing. Best ever scrambled eggs. TV reception may have been 19th century, but staff wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lvs_t_trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mid June 2010, and were very pleased with the attentiveness of the staff, and location of the hotel. It is a new hotel, only a few months open and therefore it had some very minor ’quirks’ that were immediately resolved when we contacted the front desk. There have been numerous comments re: the glass wall and door to the bathroom. We (a couple) did not find this to be a problem, as the glass was frosted for privacy. The location of the hotel was FANTASTIC. It is a 7 minute walk to the Placa Catalunya, 5 minutes to the P.Gracia metro line.....etc. Great shopping and tourist areas very close by. Breakfast was very nice. They had a variety of breads, cakes, cold meats, cheeses, fruit, cold cereal, yogurt, juice, as well as some hot buffet options (egg, potato omelette, bacon, sausage). Overall, we had a fine stay at this hotel. We would absolutely consider returning here upon a return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Its a great but unremarkable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arion003
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a great little location, about 3 blocs from placa Catalunya. Even though there is nothing wrong with the hotel, there is nothing particularly remarkable about it, except ofcourse the glass door to the loo, without any kind of a screen, might be tricky if travelling with parents or children, as the case maybe. its also a little annoying cause it lets the light in in the morning as there are no blinds in the loo either. The rooms are modern and nice although we found the bed to be smaller than our liking and smaller than we had found anywhere else in Europe. The wifi started to work only on the second day, but was accessible from the room. Didn't really eat there except a pizza the evening of one of the Spain games, which was average. At about 90 euro a night, its a decent place to stay for a few days. Again just a little unremarkable but nice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kanigel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located 10 minutes from the center of things, very clean and modern, great bathtub. Gives a value price

Reviews.Title: “Crazy - but would come back again”
Reviews.Author: brghteyez33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and in a great location. The front desk referred us to an excellent little restaurant, and provided us with maps and complimentary milk for my 18 month old. The electric went out in a portion of the hotel for quite a few hours (overnight). When we returned to the hotel to find no lights and no elevator use for our 6th floor room, the front desk promptly switched us to a second floor room, and provided candles/flashlights so I could get my child to bed. The place was impeccably clean and very affordable. With the exception of the cleaning staff, everyone spoke great English. Even with the kinks, I would definitely return here again!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL WITH GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: StenhousemuirBoxers
Reviews.Content: I was plesently suprised with this hotel after booking last minute at a very good price via the Ryanair web page. The hotel is located only 10 minutes walk from the main bus station and very easy to find. On arrival the staff were very helpful and receiving a glass of champagne after the journey was very refreshing. Our room was a 'comfort room' very modern and more importantly clean with maid service every day. No bath in this type of room but one of the best showers I have used. The pool is small and only open until 6pm and gets no sun after 3pm. The hotel is only 10 min walk to Placa De Catalunya at the top of Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but be aware of glass bathroom doors...”
Reviews.Author: ARTravel82
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spent 4 nights at the hotel and overall I thought that it is great value for money. The furniture and fittings are brand new and to a high standard, the beds are very comfortable and the location is pretty good. However, you must know that the ensuite bathrooms have sliding glass doors (in our case it was less of an issue as we had a corner room where the bathroom door was not visible from the bedroom) and I can see how this can ruin your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Really central, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MatyMooo
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on here & was a little concerned that there were so few. On arrival we found out they had only been open 3 months! We were greeted at reception by very friendly & efficient staff & a very pleasant and unexpected glass of local bubbly. We were given a local map and the receptionist took the time to point out the main sights for us. We had only booked room only as we thought €15 for breakfast was a little steep but we were given a 50% off voucher on arrival :-) Our room on the 4th floor at the back (410) was a little small but more than adequate. It had air con and lighting that worked off the room card and a great shower. Lots of freebies in the bathroom and a good mini bar. The bed was very comfortable and the flat screen TV had plenty of channels, think we found three in english. Breakfast had lots of choice from eggs and bacon, ham and cheese, pastries and different rolls and breads, juices, cereals, fresh fruit and teas and coffee's to jams so should suit just about everyone. They do seem to have a small teething problem with the flooring in the dining area but it looks as though it is being sorted and they were very careful to sign the wobbly bits. Not sure if they do a full dinner service as we ate out but there is a small menu in the bar area. We didn't use the outdoor pool as the weather wasn't fantastic but it looked great and seemed very clean - they do charge extra for towels and robes so you may want to bring your own. We did make use of the two free computers to check flight info but had to get them to re-boot the network one morning. It has a few places to sit on the ground floor and free newspapers to read in several languages. It had some really interesting lighting, but probably what you would expect from a modern hotel. We loved how central this hotel was which meant we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. Slightly disconcerting that no cab drivers knew it but it has only been opened a short while.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel, inexpensive cost”
Reviews.Author: YumWill
Reviews.Content: we booked this through lastminute.com and it was a real find. after staying in a slightly grotty apt we thought we'd splash out a bit on our last night, we were prepared to pay more for somewhere like this but at just £75 for a double comfort room we felt we got a bargain. very central yet quiet, friendly staff, everything new and modern, good breakfast - can't fault it whatsoever. do it!

HotelInfo.Name: Grupotel Gran Via 678
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via Corts Catalanes, 678, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
